9.1.18  7:36 pm   Do you feel like this two week deadline is a sustainable routine?

     it has to be

      Or did it take too much out of you?

     i failed on the 'i'm sad' video. i worked non-stop and it was 24-hours late. i lied on the website date and it didn't matter because i had no viewers. my point is this was day 2 of what became a long continuous schedule where i never missed again

9.1.18  6:52 pm   so i recently had a breakthrough in which i realized that if i post to a public space (that people pay attention to) a deadline, it's so much more real because immediately there are people expecting something of me. even if nobody really cares if i release it on that day or not i still freak out and have to get it done by that time. are you using a similar motivation with sept. 4th and the questions page? i feel like on a large enough scale it could become terrifying and overwhelming but with what i have now it works great

     i've succeeded and failed at many deadlines, public and private. one thing i've learned is to never even hint at a deadline unless i'm absolutely sure, because people will harass the hell out of me even if i miss even just some date that may have been just a fraction of an inferred implication made only as a response to ruthless prodding and then taken out of context

9.1.18  6:27 pm   you claim to not want a melodica just because everyone else uses one,

     i never said that's the only reason

      but you sing in your songs even though everyone else does too?
